Tol RI Tertinggal dari Cina, Jokowi: Jangan Ada yang Tepuk Tangan
06 Nov 2019, 23:31 by Caesar Akbar, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi mengatakan bakal terus melanjutkan pembangunan infrastruktur. Sebab, kata dia, stok infrastruktur Indonesia masih jauh tertinggal dari negara lain.
Mengambil contoh pembangunan jalan tol, Jokowi membandingkan pembangunan jalur bebas hambatan di Indonesia dengan Cina. Sejak pembangunan jalan tol Jakarta-Bogor-Ciawi pada 1978 hingga 2014, tuturnya, Indonesia hanya membangun sekitar 780 kilometer jalan tol.
"Cina sampai saat ini sudah membangun 280 ribu kilometer jalan tol, jangan ada yang tepuk tangan, kita hanya 780 kilometer selama 40 tahun, ini yang sering ekstrem saya bilang, kita tertinggal jauh," ujar Jokowi di Jakarta Internasional Expo, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Karena itu, dia mengatakan dalam lima tahun ke belakang ia menggeber pekerjaan pembangunan jalan tol dilakukan secara intensif, tiga shift setiap harinya. Walhasil hingga akhir 2019, Indonesia diperkirakan memiliki kurang lebih 1.500 kilometer jalan tol anyar.
"Dan kami harapkan nanti dalam lima tahun ke depan panjang ruas tol berada pada angka sekitar 4.500-5.000 kilometer jalan tol kita," ujar dia.
Bersamaan dengan itu, dia mengatakan peringkat Indonesia dalam pembangunan infrastruktur pun melonjak 30 peringkat ke peringkat 52 pada 2019 dibanding 9 tahun lalu. Menurutnya, pencapaian itu sangat baik, meski Indonesia masih tertinggal dari negara lain.
Sebelumnya, Deputi Bidang Sarana dan Prasarana Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Nasional Kennedy SImanjuntak mengatakan langkah Presiden Jokowi yang masih memprioritaskan pembangunan infrastruktur dalam lima tahun ke depan sudah sesuai dengan data yang dimiliki Bappenas. Kennedy mengatakan infrastruktur Indonesia masih jauh dari level dunia.
"Infrastruktur kita masih jauh dari level dunia, kalau kita lihat, stok infrastruktur kita baru 43 persen dari Produk Domestik Bruto," ujar Kennedy dalam diskusi di Jakarta International Expo, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019. Ia mengatakan di level dunia, stok infrastruktur berada di kisaran 70 persen dari Produk Domestik Bruto.
Ia mengatakan dalam lima tahun terakhir pemerintah telah menggenjot masuknya investasi sekitar tiga kali lipat untuk untuk mengejar ketertinggalan infrastruktur tersebut. Kendati angka dunia memang belum tercapai. "Karena itu arahan presiden sangat penting dan sesuai dengan kondisi yang diharapkan," kata Kennedy.
Di periode kedua pemerintahan Jokowi, Kennedy mengatakan infrastruktur akan difokuskan kepada pelayanan dasar, perekonomian, dan perkotaan. Kendati demikian, ada perbedaan fokus pengembangan infrastruktur antara lima tahun ke depan dan sebelumnya, yaitu konektivitas untuk menunjang ekonomi.

CAESAR AKBAR

RI Toll Road Behind from China, Jokowi: Don't Give a Applause
06 Nov 2019, 23:31 by Caesar Akbar, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - President Joko Widodo or Jokowi said that they would continue to develop infrastructure. Because, he said, Indonesia's infrastructure stock is still far behind that of other countries.
Taking the example of toll road construction, Jokowi compared the construction of expressways in Indonesia with China. Since the construction of the Jakarta-Bogor-Ciawi toll road in 1978 to 2014, he said, Indonesia only built around 780 kilometers of toll roads.
"China has so far built 280 thousand kilometers of toll roads, don't give a round of applause, we have only 780 kilometers for 40 years, this is often extreme, I say, we are far behind," Jokowi said at the Jakarta International Expo, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Therefore, he said that in the past five years he had been carrying out intensive toll road construction work, three shifts every day. As a result, by the end of 2019, Indonesia is estimated to have approximately 1,500 kilometers of new toll roads.
"And we hope that in the next five years the length of toll roads will be around 4,500-5,000 kilometers of our toll roads," he said.
At the same time, he said Indonesia's ranking in infrastructure development had jumped 30 to 52 in 2019 compared to 9 years ago. According to him, the achievement was very good, even though Indonesia was still lagging behind other countries.
Previously, Deputy for Facilities and Infrastructure of the National Development Planning Agency, Kennedy SImanjuntak, said that President Jokowi's steps, which still prioritize infrastructure development in the next five years, were in accordance with data held by Bappenas. Kennedy said Indonesia's infrastructure was far from world level.
"Our infrastructure is still far from the world level, if we look at it, our infrastructure stock is only 43 percent of Gross Domestic Product," Kennedy said in a discussion at the Jakarta International Expo, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019. He said at the world level, infrastructure stock in the range of 70 percent of Gross Domestic Product.
He said that in the last five years the government had boosted around threefold investment to catch up with the infrastructure. Even though world numbers have not yet been reached. "Therefore the direction of the president is very important and in accordance with the expected conditions," Kennedy said.
In the second period of Jokowi's administration, Kennedy said infrastructure would be focused on basic services, the economy, and cities. Nevertheless, there is a difference in the focus of infrastructure development between the next five years and before, namely connectivity to support the economy.
